item.title: Creative Destiny 2 Titan Gives Their Guardian a Pennywise-Inspired Makeover
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • A Destiny 2 player transforms their Titan into Pennywise using clever shaders and ornaments, successfully mimicking the clown's white outfit and red hair.
  • The Pennywise setup even includes a festive ship and a Legendary emote from Destiny 2 Season 25.

A Destiny 2 player has impressed with a setup that transforms their Titan into the terrifying Pennywise. Although it was released in 2017, Destiny 2 continues to stand the test of time thanks to the injection of content through frequent updates, which add new ornaments and shaders that have been used with great ingenuity by the community.

Through these resources, Guardians often get incredible new looks, whether inspired by original ideas or by works of pop culture. When it comes to movies, the community has already shown its creativity by doing things like turning a Guardian into the Wicked Witch of the West. There are other examples, such as Frodo from Lord of the Rings , The Bride from Kill Bill , and Gambit from the X-Men. This time, another Destiny 2 player created a build inspired by a character known by horror fans around the world, sharing the result online.

Redditor Accomplished_Mobile7 turned their Titan into Pennywise, one of cinema's most terrifying clowns. The build is based on the use of two shaders, Honors of the Nine, which gives the armor a predominantly white tone, and Noble Constant Red, which gives the top of the Titan's head a red tone that recreates the clown's hair. The Legendary ornaments worn by the Titan are Valkyrian Gauntlets, Contender Plate, Techeuns Regalia Greaves, Legatus Mark, and Aphotic Lamellar Helm. The final item is the build's most impressive ornament, as it gives the Guardian a touch closer to Pennywise's original appearance.

Destiny 2 Titan Scares by Dressing as Pennywise

In addition to sharing the ornaments and shaders used in the Pennywise-inspired setup, the OP showed off the ship they created, which resembles a bumper car. They also snapped photos of the Pennywise Titan at different moments, one of which attracted the curiosity of other players because the character appeared holding a balloon. This is the Legendary emote “Have a Balloon,” one of the new items introduced with the release of Destiny 2 Season 25. The first act of the season started on October 8, with the other two set to release in the coming months.

For fans of the horror genre, IT has proven to be an incredibly popular franchise. Based on the novel by Stephen King, the series tells of the horrors caused by Pennywise, an evil entity who disguises himself as a clown, exploits his victims' fears, and hunts them down. IT has had two film adaptations and two miniseries, with a third production on the way. Named Welcome to Derry , the upcoming television series will premiere on HBO Max in 2025.

item.title: Fallout 76: Best Camp Locations
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Players can build in various unique locations in Fallout 76, with options to suit different preferences.
  • Building in multiple locations allows for flexibility when one spot is occupied on a server.
  • The chosen locations offer benefits such as water access, security, or strategic advantages for fast travel or trade.

There are many great places to build in Fallout 76 . From large open areas to places with existing structures that players can incorporate into their builds, there are options to suit everyone. While selecting the perfect place to build can feel like a big decision, players can now build more than one CAMP.

Players often choose to have a CAMP build set up in several locations. That way, if one location is occupied on a particular server, they can simply activate another one. Building plays a big part in the world of Fallout 76 . Players love coming up with new and creative builds to show off to other wastelanders.

Updated on November 2, 2024, by Benjamin Joe: There's almost no end to CAMP placement options in Fallout 76. Because of this, there are always more places that can be included on this list. While the original list contained a lot of great locations throughout the map, it didn't contain a lot of areas in the Cranberry Bog. This region is one of the hardest regions to survive in. There are lots of tough enemies spread all over the place. That said, it's a place where lots of high-level players choose to build. There are plenty of open and flat areas to build in. Also, the area, while dangerous, is also really stunning.

1 The Seneca Rock Bridge

Strategic, Lovely, Elevated Terrain That Blends Natural Beauty With Survival Fears

Pros

Cons

Stunning Landscape

A Tricky Location To Build In

Little To No Enemy Interference

Players Can Spawn Under The Base

It's A Large Area To Build

Players Can Fall Off And Die Easily

Very Few Players Build Here

Not Many Resources

There is a beautiful Seneca Rock Cabin and a Pleasant Valley Cabin across the Seneca Rock Bridge. The building of the bridge shows how unique the Appalachian scenery is. The Seneca Rock Bridge's high location makes it safer from attacks from below . One thing that stands out is how beautiful and useful the area is.

Because the place is so famous, it draws various threats. But, by building high up, players aren't likely to encounter much enemy interference. Players can get water from the Seneca Rock Bridge, it's easy to defend, and it's a good spot to be able to fast travel to for free.

2 Morgantown Trainyard

Resource-Rich Industrial Center With The Ability To Create Strategic Defenses

Pros

Cons

Lots of Low-Level Player Traffic

High Chance of Enemy Attacks

Easy To Build A Base That Fits Into Its Surroundings

Not Much Flat Terrain To Build off

Plenty of Resources

Not Much Here For High-Level Players

In Fallout 76 , the Morgantown Trainyard Camp is great because it has everything players will need . The camp is west of the trainyard, in the Appalachian Forest. There are some resources in the area, making it a good place to build for lower-level players.

It's quite close to a few notable locations which makes it ideal for those who don't have a lot of Caps. Fast traveling can be quite costly for new players. So, having a CAMP set up near key travel points can help players hang on to their hard-earned Caps.

3 The Noose Tree

Spooky Beauty, Haunting Ambiance, And Possibilities For Creative Camp Construction

Pros

Cons

Breathtaking Views

Building Here Can Be A Bit Buggy

Pretty Flat Terrain For Building

Not A Lot of Player Traffic

Not A Lot of Enemies Around

The Nearby Sensor Can Interfere With Building

The Noose Tree camp has a horror movie feel. The environment shows the remains of a skeleton with an eerie beauty. Survivors like this place because it has a unique, spooky atmosphere with a sense of disturbed beauty .

The area is flat, which makes it easy for players to build up their base in any direction. The view of the area is breathtaking. The great views and the lonesome hanging noose make this the perfect place for a Halloween-themed build. The only major downside of this area is that it isn't a high-traffic location, meaning that players may struggle to get visitors.

4 Mole Miner Tunnel

Beautiful Underground, Many Resources, Challenging Directions, And A Distinctive Camp Location

Pros

Cons

Allows Players To Build Fun And Unique Bases

A Little Out of The Way

Open Landscape

Gets Attacked Fairly Frequently

The Mole Miner Tunnel is a fairly unique place to build. The cool, open landscape is a big draw for players. The underground tunnels help to add more depth to a player's base. By building here, it is easy to create an immersive base that fits in with its surroundings.

The interconnected caverns make the area safer from attacks. The camp has a lot of useful things that bring out the beauty of the area. To get around well in the underground tunnels as players, they will need to plan their camp perfectly.

5 EL-B1-02 Relay Tower

A Relatively Open Area For Building

Pros

Cons

Lots of Players Travel Through This Region

Lots of Other Players Build Here

A Fairly Flat Landscape

Prone To Enemy Attacks

Good Location For Free Fast Travel

Not The Best Views

Another great camp option is the EL-B1-02 Relay Tower. The flat ground, drinking water, food, and ability to protect against battle or existing threats make the camp stand out. This location generally brings in wandering creatures and players.

The EL-B1-02 Relay Tower has good visibility of surrounding areas but is also open to threats. Protecting the CAMP is fairly straightforward, especially with a few well-placed turrets.

6 Lake On The Mountain

A Peaceful Haven With Access To Water And Strategic Camping Possibilities

Pros

Cons

Fun For A Water Build

Building on Water Can Be Tricky

Plenty of Resources

The Potential For Tough Enemy Attacks

A Decent Amount of Player Traffic

Not Ideal For Low-Level Players

In Fallout 76 , the Lake on the Mountain is a famous and peaceful place to camp. At the same time, enemies don't spawn all that often. However, when they do, they tend to be pretty tough enemies. Because of this, it may not be the best place for low-level players to set up CAMP.

Wanderers can find a balance between peace and the constant risks in the Fallout 76 world by setting up camp near the lake on the mountain. It's a great place to build a waterside base.

7 North of Greg's Mine Supply

An Ideal Mid-Level Building Location

Pros

Cons

The Forest Region is Aesthetically Pleasing

Not A Lot Here For High-Level Players

Lots of Flat Land

Attacks Can Happen Fairly Frequently

Not A Lot of Players Build Here

Not A Lot of Player Traffic

By heading a little north of Greg's Mine Supply, players will find a fairly large area in the forest with very few obstructions. This area is good for building on flat ground. That said, it doesn't come without its drawbacks.

Attacks tend to happen fairly frequently around this area. Although, it's worth noting that the enemies typically aren't that difficult to deal with. Since it is a large forest area, it's easy and fun to build a camouflage-style base that fits neatly into the landscape.

Alternatively, players can use the road that runs through this region to build their own diner or shopping center that fits neatly into the surrounding area.

8 New Gad

A Dried-Up Lake Filled With Super Mutants

Pros

Cons

Lots of Water

Frequent Super Mutant Attacks

A Good Free Central Fast Travel Location

Aside From Water, Not A Lot of Resources

A Lot of Flat Land

Can Be Seen As A Bit Boring

This Super Mutant-infested area is a great place to build for those players who enjoy lots of plain, flat land that they can build off. Since there are lots of prefabs that players can place, New Gad is a great place to build for players who like to build their bases quickly.

While the Super Mutants tend to attack pretty often, a few strategically placed turrets should take care of them. Unfortunately, there aren't a lot of resources around, aside from water sources. So, for players who love resource-rich areas, it may be best to pick another location.

9 North Of Whitespring Station

One of The Most Popular Build Locations

Pros

Cons

Lots of Player Traffic

Quite A Lot of Competition For Build Space

Attacks Aren't Very Frequent

There Are Already Free Fast Travel Points Nearby

The Train Track Can Be Incorporated Into The Build

Not A Lot of Large Structures To Incorporate Into A Build

The area around Whitespring Station is one of the most popular places to build in all of Fallout 76. Lots of players use The Whitespring Station as a central trading post, making this area a great place to get lots of visitors to a player's base.

While the competition is fierce, it is worth having at least one CAMP in this location. Since Fallout 76 gave players the ability to own more than one CAMP, if the player's primary CAMP spot is occupied, then they can just open up the menu and place down one of their other CAMP builds.

With it being a central point on the map, it is a great location to set up shop and sell items to other players.

10 Whitespring Golf Course

A Very Popular Place To Call Home

Pros

Cons

A Very Popular Place For Players To Visit

Lots of Players Build Here

Whitespring Robots Can Help Ward off Enemies

High Chance of Enemy Attacks

Lots of Flat Land

Not A Lot of Resources

Nice Views of Pre-War Appalachia

Players Often Nuke This Area

The Whitespring Golf Course is in the Whitespring area of Fallout 7 6. This camp costs a lot and has a nice view of the scenery. The best thing about the Whitespring Golf Course is how safe it is. While the previous inhabitants can cause issues, there is a team of Whitespring Robots that do their best to handle any unruly Ghouls. That said, this probably isn't the best location to build for low-level players, as they will find themselves getting attacked fairly frequently.

The Whitespring Golf Course is also a fairly large area. So, it's possible for multiple players to build in close proximity to each other. Typically, a server will have at least two CAMPs set up in this area.

11 North Of Drop Site V9

An Open Area That Is Close To A Boss Battle Site

Pros

Cons

Lots Of Flat Land To Build On

Lots Of Dangerous Enemies

Plenty Of Player Traffic

This Area Often Gets Nuked

Close To Watoga (Great For Finding Enclave Box Mods)

Quite A Lot Of Competition For CAMP Placement

Drop Site V9 is a great place to set up shop for those looking to make lots of sales. This area is right next to Fissure Site Prime. This is where the Scorched Earth event takes place . It's the first boss battle that players are likely to encounter. It's a very popular event that sees players from all over the server join, making it an ideal location to build in as there will always be a steady flow of customers.

If the player places their CAMP north of Drop Site V9, then they will avoid most of the nukes that land in that area. Also, the whole area is open and flat with very few unmovable objects, making it a pretty easy area to build in.

12 Near The Flooded Trainyard

A Large Flat Area With Few Enemy Spawn Points

Pros

Cons

Lots Of Flat Land

A Little Out Of The Way

Not A Lot Of Enemy Interference

Not The Best Place For Making Sales

Just east of the Flooded Trainyard there's a pretty large flat area which is perfect for building. While the player will encounter some enemies every now and then, for the most part, it's a relatively peaceful place to build in. While this location doesn't get a lot of natural player traffic, those who do venture to this area are typically high-level players. High-level players are more likely to have a nice stash of Caps that they are always willing to spend.

One other good thing about this location is its usefulness for completing challenges. Players will often receive challenges that involve killing cryptids. Snallygasters are cryptids, and the Flooded Trainyard is a guaranteed spawn point for Snallygasters. If the player has their CAMP nearby, then they can quickly and easily tick off any challenges that involve killing these beasts.

13 Near Camp Liberty

A Cool Cave Hideout

Pros

Cons

Rarely Attacked By Enemies

A Little Out Of The Way

Stunning Views of Skyline Valley

Can Be Tricky Placing Items Over The Waterfall

A Great Place To Farm Purified Water

Not A Lot Of Player Traffic

If the player heads directly northeast of Camp Liberty, then they will come across a large cliff with a waterfall trickling down the side. Not only is this a fantastic location for a CAMP, it also has a little hidden secret.

At the base of the waterfall, there's a small cave that players can build inside. While there isn't a lot of space, it's a fun little bonus area where players can build. If placed correctly, then the player will be able to build at the top of the waterfall and inside the little cave at the bottom.

14 West Of Research Site Saxony

A Pree-Built Treehouse

Pros

Cons

Comes With A Two-Story Treehouse

Prone To Super Mutant Attacks

Relatively Open Build Area

This Area is Often Overlooked By Players

The Treehouse is Pretty Empty

Building Around The Treehouse Can Be Tricky

Just west of Research Site Saxony, there's a large treehouse where players can place their CAMP. This is the perfect place for players who enjoy incorporating existing structures into their builds.

The interior is very empty, except for a radio on the top floor. It's a great blank canvas for those who have creative outdoor build ideas. While it is prone to Super Mutant attacks, a couple of well-placed turrets should keep them at bay. That said, the treehouse does offer some natural protection as the structure can't be destroyed by enemies.

15 Three Ponds

A Stunning View Of Skyline Valley

Pros

Cons

Plenty Of Places To Build

Challenging Terrain To Build On

Amazing Views Of The Skyline Valley Region

An Enemy Spawn Location

If the player's main focus is the view, then Three Ponds is the perfect place to set up CAMP. There are large ponds along a cliffside that overlooks the entire Skyline Valley region. It's an ideal location for those wanting to make a waterside retreat.

Players can choose to place their CAMP next to any of the ponds in this area. Also, if the player places their CAMP in just the right spot, then they can build in the top section of the area as well as at the base of the cliff.

item.title: The Sims 4: How to Create and Complete a Bucket List
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How to Start a Bucket List in The Sims 4
    • How to Write the Perfect Goal in a Bucket List in The Sims 4
  • How to Complete the Soul's Journey in The Sims 4
  • Soul's Journey Rewards in The Sims 4

Death is an important part of a Sims life, and the Life and Death expansion pack for The Sims 4 embraces this fact, which can be hard to face sometimes. Before staring death in the eyes, many Sims will want to feel like they've life to the maximum, and one of the best ways to do this is to scratch everything off their bucket list.

This guide will tell players everything they need to know about creating and completing a bucket list in The Sims 4 so their Sims can enter an eternal slumber knowing they did everything they wanted to do before it was time to cross the rainbow bridge.

How to Start a Bucket List in The Sims 4

Players can start a bucket list in The Sims 4 by interacting with a Private Journal or a Computer and selecting the Bucket List option. Here, gamers can add goals to their bucket list according to the following options:

  • Write Goal
  • Write Goal from Category
  • Write the Perfect Goal

Gamers can select a completely random goal, choose an objective related to a category, or write a specific goal.

Players can have up to four items on their bucket list, and if they aren't happy with the goals that they've gotten, they can always scratch the bucket list's goals and retry later. However, if they want full control of their next bucket list goal, there are certain ways to unlock the option to write the perfect bucket list goal in The Sims 4 .

How to Write the Perfect Goal in a Bucket List in The Sims 4

There are three ways to gain access to the perfect goal option in The Sims 4 's bucket list feature. Here's how:

  • Attend an Afterlife Anonymous group meeting in the ruins in Ravenwood's Mourningvale neighborhood
  • Witness another Sim die recently
  • Have the Chased by Death trait

With the perfect goal interaction unlocked, gamers are able to see the list of available goals in each category and pick any option they like.

How to Complete the Soul's Journey in The Sims 4

The path of the Soul's Journey has eight milestones in total, and players will have to complete all of them to finish the Soul's Journey in The Sims 4 .

To get through the first six milestones, players must scratch six items off their bucket list. Doing so, completes the Sim's journey as a living Sim, allowing them to be reborn upon death. However, the last two milestones in the Soul's Journey are exclusive to Ghost Sims , and this is how you unlock the Burning Soul trait, which allows a more powerful Rebirth. Therefore, to truly complete a Soul's Journey in The Sims 4 , the Sim must die so they can finish their Unfinished Business.

After a Sim dies, players must select the "Become a Playable Ghost" option to continue controlling them as a Ghost Sim.

Soul's Journey Rewards in The Sims 4

As Sims check more items off their bucket list, they'll get closer to completing their Soul's Journey.

Soul's Journey Milestone

Reward

1 - The Road Ahead

  • Receive extra Satisfaction Points

2 - Making Headway

  • Receive extra skill gain bonuses

3 - Finding Purpose

  • Receive extra career performance gains
  • Receive discounts on computer purchases
  • Access the Share Soul's Journey social interaction

4 - No Regrets

  • Increases life span as a living Sim
  • Unlocks the ability to Move Onto the Great Beyond as a ghost

5 - Quite a Journey

  • Access the Pass Down social interaction
  • Ability to create more Heirlooms

6 - Dream Fulfilled

  • Ability to Rebirth upon death
  • Ability to Rebirth as a ghost

7 - Newfound Purpose (Ghost Sim exclusive)

  • Receive extra Ghost Mastery experience points

8 - The Big Picture (Ghost Sim exclusive)

  • Increases Ghost Mastery stamina
  • Unlocks the Burning Soul trait, giving the Sim access to the Recall Past Life and the Peer into Soul interactions

Ultimately, going through the Soul's Journey in The Sims 4 grants the Sim the ability to Rebirth, which allows them to be born into the same family or a completely different household. Additionally, completing it in full gives the Sim the Burning Soul trait , which makes it so they can recall some of the personality traits in their past lives and gain skills faster.

item.title: Metaphor: ReFantazio - 10 Best Archetypes for Late Game, Ranked
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Choosing the right archetypes is crucial for late-game success in Metaphor: ReFantazio, offering powerful abilities and synergy.
  • Archetypes like Dragoon, Tycoon, and Elemental Master offer unique strengths in combat, enhancing team performance significantly.
  • Late-game options like Devil Summoner, Soul Hacker, and Royal Archetypes bring powerful and unique abilities crucial for overcoming tough challenges.

Metaphor: ReFantazio , one of Atlus's acclaimed games, stands out by introducing archetypes that function as classes. With these archetypes, players unlock abilities and enhance attributes, creating unique strategies that enrich the combat experience. Familiarity with Persona mechanics makes the game even more appealing to JRPG fans.

In the late game, choosing the right archetypes can be the difference between victory and defeat. This analysis explores the best archetypes to face the final challenges, highlighting powerful options that offer essential resistance, strength, and support. Discover the combinations that elevate team performance and ensure an unparalleled strategic experience.

10 Dragoon

Capable Of Dealing Damage From A Safe Position

  • Requirements: Neuras Bond 8, Sniper Rank 20, Magic Knight 10
  • MAG Cost: 22,500

The game features a row system where characters can retreat, causing less damage in exchange for more defense, and although some classes work well in the back row, none do it as well as the Dragoon. This archetype also learns attacks of different elemental affinities, making it easy to exploit weaknesses.

Thus, while attacking from a safe position and taking less damage when targeted by enemy attacks, the Dragoon can easily help the rest of the party by creating new turn icons when hitting an opponent's weakness. Regarding Synthesis Skills, they are also useful in many battles, making it excellent for different compositions.

9 Tycoon

Source Of Money And Damage

  • Requirements: Brigitta Bond 8, Merhcant Rank 20, Command Rank 10
  • MAG Cost: 24,000

For the late game, it is necessary for players to have both Reeves, the currency used for purchases in the shops of Metaphor: ReFantazio , as well as MAG, used to unlock archetypes and new abilities to be inherited. Thus, the Tycoon is an excellent option to farm both currencies.

Besides earning a lot of money for the party, especially when equipped on the protagonist and his Hero Passive is activated, the Tycoon is also useful in combat, using gold pieces to deal damage. Being a relatively easy resource to find and the attack being of the Almighty type, which ignores any target resistance, the Tycoon is a great archetype to be a wildcard in many battles.

8 Elemental Master

The Most Powerful Spells In Metaphor: ReFantazio

  • Requirements: Gallica Bond 8, Wizard Rank 20
  • MAG Cost: 16,500

The Wizard lineage has a very good Hero Passive, which recovers the party's MP when defeating an enemy in an overworld combat and, fortunately, is also very good for the late game of Metaphor: ReFantazio . This is because the Elemental Master has access to powerful spells capable of hitting multiple enemy weaknesses.

The Elemental Master is also very useful when using Synthesis Skills, since at rank 12 of the archetype, players gain access to the ability Magic Link, which halves MP cost, making these group abilities more frequent. Additionally, the Wizard Lineage also has the Warlock, another extremely powerful class, but focused on Dark magic, not as versatile but still useful.

7 Devil Summoner

The Class's Summons Are Extremely Powerful

  • Requirements: Eupha Bond 6, Summoner Rank 20, Magic Seeker Rank 10
  • MAG Cost: 28,500

Another archetype unlocked only in the late game of Metaphor: ReFantazio , but which also works very well in the game, is the Summoner, especially the class evolution, Devil Summoner. However, despite being powerful, it requires some grinding from players, as summons only appear when Vessels are created in the Akademia.

Thus, the Summoner has access to a wide variety of different abilities during the game's combats, being able to exploit all enemy weaknesses with massive amounts of damage. When in the right composition, for example, this lineage can shine even more due to the synergy it possesses.

6 Soul Hacker

Extremely Useful For The Largest Dungeons In The Game

  • Requirements: More Bond 6, Magic Seeker Rank 20
  • MAG Cost: 16,500

In the final part of Atlus's game plot, players may encounter some massive dungeons that will consume a lot of MP before finally facing the boss. For this, the Soul Hacker emerges as one of the best options for the late game of Metaphor: ReFantazio , offering excellent attacks to be used in battle.

Moreover, many of the Soul Hacker's spells and other synthesis skills offer a unique and extremely useful mechanic, which is to recover the user's MP for each hit that lands. Considering that many abilities here can reach all opponents, it is an extremely favorable exchange, as while reducing their HP, the archetype's user also maintains MP sustain.

5 Paladin

Excellent Tank During Battles

  • Requirements: Hulkenberg Bond 7, Magic Knight Rank 20
  • MAG Cost: 18,750

Keeping the team standing is one of the priorities that every player should have during the game's squad battles, as a small slip can make enemies, especially bosses, finish the fight in just one turn. To reduce the chances of that happening, the Paladin is one of the best tanks in the late game of Metaphor: ReFantazio .

Alongside abilities that attract the attention of opponents, the Paladin has chances to reflect physical damage received back at enemies, as well as being able to heal allies. Players can also opt for Dark Knight, another archetype option from the Knight Lineage, which can defend the party but also attack when necessary.

4 Martial Artist

High Damage Without Consuming MP

  • Requirements: Catherina Bond 8, Pugilist Rank 20
  • MAG Cost: 20,625

One of the biggest problems faced by players during all the dungeons of Metaphor: ReFantazio is keeping the characters' MP at a level that, when they reach the bosses, they can use skills consistently. Although there are various techniques for this, the Brawler is a useful solution.

Most of the damage skills of this lineage, especially the Martial Artist, consume HP instead of the character's MP, allowing players to spam abilities without worrying about running out of this resource, only about staying alive. Thus, players can align the archetype with support focused on recovering the damage taken, making a consistent choice for the late game of Metaphor: ReFantazio .

3 Samurai

High Physical Damage To All Opponents

  • Requirements: Strohl Bond 7, Swordmaster Rank 20, General Rank 10
  • MAG Cost: 16,500

Even though the Warrior is one of the first options introduced in the game, it is an archetype that is consistent throughout, being an excellent option at any time. The evolutions to Swordmaster and Samurai add even more utility to the character, who can deal massive amounts of physical damage to all opponents.

Additionally, the Samurai has many resources through abilities to stay alive, casting buffs on the user at the start of the battle and also being able to recover a considerable amount of HP at the beginning of each turn. The Synthesis Skills are also good options, as some can even add new turn icons if the enemy dies from that attack.

2 Persona Master

Excellent For Creating Weaknesses In Enemies

  • Requirements: Junah Bond 6, Masked Dancer Rank 20, Faker Rank 10
  • MAG Cost: 28,500

The class name is a reference to Atlus's Persona franchise, but it has enough qualities to be considered one of the best archetypes in Metaphor: ReFantazio on its own. This is because it is a completely customizable option, with players being able to manipulate their own characters' weaknesses and resistances.

Besides being able to adapt to different situations, the Persona Master also stands out in the game by being able to have the same effect against opponents, creating weaknesses for other characters to exploit. So, despite not having such offensive abilities during the late game, this archetype is one of the best supports for the final part of Metaphor: ReFantazio , making many compositions viable.

1 Royal Archetypes

Exclusive And Unique Options For Each Character

  • Requirements: Conditions vary by companion
  • MAG Cost: Conditions vary by companion

Despite the effort players need to have companions unlock the Royal Archetypes, it is an effort that is worth it during the late game of the story, as they are classes with powerful abilities that change the flow of battle. Furthermore, each of the companions available in the story has an exclusive in this category.

For this reason, they are among the best archetypes for the late game of Metaphor: ReFantazio , since in addition to being linked to each character's initial concept, the options of abilities and builds that players have access to are powerful. Moreover, when the four main party characters are equipped with Royal Archetypes, the group has access to a Synthesis Skill capable of dealing 9,999 damage to an opponent.

item.title: HoYoverse’s ‘Starry Sky Valley’ Game Rumors Explained
item.description:
HoYoverse has notched several hits under their belts with Genshin Impact , Honkai: Star Rail , and now Zenless Zone Zero . But reports have suggested that another installment, Starry Sky Valley , is on its way. Starry Sky Valley also seems to diverge from HoYoverse’s roster so far genre-wise, making it an interesting addition to the brand.

Genshin Impact , Honkai: Star Rail , and Zenless Zone Zero have all skyrocketed in popularity since their respective launches. All of these games from Chinese developer HoYoverse, formerly known as miHoYo, fall somewhat under the action-adventure role-playing genre. However, information on Starry Sky Valley suggests that it won’t follow in the footsteps of its predecessors and instead shift genres entirely.

How Starry Sky Valley Was Uncovered

Starry Sky Valley ’s title was first leaked after the phrase was trademarked by HoYoverse with the Chinese government. It should be noted that this name may change once the game is officially announced by HoYoverse as Starry Sky Valley is a rough and literal translation of the Chinese trademark. The leak and translation came from known HoYoverse leaker @hxgdiluc on X (formerly known as Twitter). The X user also posted screenshots of a Bilibili account, a popular Chinese streaming platform, registered with Starry Sky Valley .

HoYoverse has yet to officially announce the game or comment on any leaks relating to the alleged title. Rumors of an Animal Crossing competitor from HoYoverse have been raging since a series of leaks back in 2023. It seems that Starry Sky Valley is this alleged simulation game, adding yet another cozy game to the genre.

Considering the increased popularity of cozy games and the mass revenue HoYoverse receives from its other titles, creating a simulation game seems like a smart move for the Chinese developer. Starry Sky Valley leakers might not benefit from the buzz they’re generating for HoYoverse, as the company is known for taking legal action against leakers. Nevertheless, these rumors have generated intense excitement among HoYoverse’s fan base which the developer may lean into.

New Developments in Starry Sky Valley

A select few HoYoverse fans have received mysterious emails from the studio, inviting them to a confidential play test for an unknown game. Reports list the playtest to occur the weekend of November 16 and 17 onsite in Los Angeles, California. No information on the game’s content is mentioned in the email, meaning the playtest could be for a new HoYoverse title or a preexisting one. Regardless, the contents of the game seem fairly juicy as players will be required to sign a non-disclosure agreement if they participate. They will also receive an Amazon gift card as compensation.

With rumors about Starry Sky Valley circulating for over a year, it seems reasonable that HoYoverse would try to release the game as soon as possible. At the very least, testing for the game seems like a move that would quench the thirst of leakers in Hoyoverse’s fanbase.

Images from Starry Sky Valley Have Been Leaked Previously

Leaked images from the game have shown avatars in HoYoverse’s classic chibi art style frolicking through an open field to chop down trees. These chopping animations and leaked images of the game’s crafting interface are incredibly derivative of Animal Crossing: New Horizons , further evidence that HoYoverse may be trying to compete with the longstanding Nintendo franchise.

However, unlike the Nintendo property, Starry Sky Valley ’s visuals seem to feature a movable camera. This is a mechanic that Animal Crossing does not have, with cameras always being fixed. Perhaps Starry Sky Valley will focus on improving upon established parts of Animal Crossing as part of the game’s draw.

Ultimately, this upcoming play test will either confirm or negate Starry Sky Valley ’s leaks. HoYoverse fans will have to wait until the playtest begins on November 16 for new leaked information about the developer’s next title.
